sentences.sContent: Do you want to hear some juicy gossip ?
sentences.sCn: 你想听些有趣的传闻吗？

sentences.sContent: She had no time for idle gossip .
It was common gossip how he felt about her.
sentences.sCn: 他对她的看法，大家都在议论纷纷。

sentences.sContent: You miss a lot of office gossip when you have a day off work.
sentences.sCn: 请一天假，你就会错过办公室里的许多小道消息。

sentences.sContent: On Sundays all the men gather in the square to exchange local gossip .
sentences.sCn: 每到星期天，男人们就聚集在广场上，飞短流长地说一些当地的新闻。

synos.tran: 小道传闻；随笔；爱说长道短的人

phrases.pCn: 绯闻少女（美国一青春偶像剧）

words.tran: 爱闲聊的人；搬弄是非者（gossip的名词形式）

remMethod.val: go(进行) ＋ s ＋ sip(吸吮) → 流言蜚语能吸干人的精力 → 传播流言蜚语

trans.tranOther: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks
